content: materials 100g self-striping sock yarn mc minimal use of white and black yarn 3g each maybe these are the two ccs 2 5mm needles or size to obtain gauge 2 75mm needles for colourwork yarn needle scissors instructions cuff with mc cast on 64 stitches with a stretchy cast-on like old norwegian cast-on and join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches k2 p2 ribbing for approximately 10 rounds or until cuff reaches desired length with mc knit two rounds on the second round increase two stitches evenly for a total of 66 ghost motif change to black background cc and 2 75mm needles and knit as in chart a adding the white cc as shown in chart a be sure to catch your floats if they are longer than about 4 stitches chart a leg break both ccs leaving tails to weave in later rejoin mc switching back to 2 5mm knit one round decreasing two stitches evenly to return to 64 stitches this round is counted as round 1 in chart b for chart b you can repeat it twice if you want the lace to go around the whole leg or just do it on the front of the leg chart b continue working chart b until leg is desired length ending on a round 4 heel rs knit the first 32 stitches and hold the remainder back row 1 ws *sl 1 p1 across row 2 rs sl1 *k across repeat row 1&2 until heel is desired length or until you have worked 32 row total work row 1 again so you will begin the heel turn on a knit side heel turn row 1 sl 1 k17 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1 p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl k6 ssk k1 turn repeat row 2&3 each time there will be more k s and p s in between the gap where you will then ssk rs or p2tog ws across the gap until all heel stitches have been worked foot and gusset knit across your remaining heel stitches then pick up the stitches along the sides of the heel flap m1 to close the gap between the instep and the heel start chart b again on round 1 for the instep it is helpful to mark the beginning and end of the instep m1 at the end of the instep and pick up the stitches on the other side of the heel flap decrease round knit to 3 stitches before the beginning of the instep then k2tog k1 knit next instep chart line then k1 ssk continuing decreasing your gusset stitches by knitting one round then a decrease round until you have 32 sole stitches left once both sole and instep have 32 stitches continuing the instep pattern as charted in chart b and the sole is all knit stitches until about 1 5 inches until your desired length or wherever you usually begin doing the toe toe round 1
